content: 1 a row of owls by samantha west the inspiration for this hat was drawn from a vintage cross stitch owl design materials one 3 25mm / us size 3 circular needle 40cm / 16 in length or size needed to meet the required gauge one 2 75mm / us size 2 circular needle 40cm / 16 in length or one us size smaller than needle size used to obtain gauge one 3 25mm / us size 3 circular needle 80cm / 32 or 100cm / 40 in length for magic loop or one set of 3 25mm / us size 3 dpns or size needed to meet the required gauge optional stitch markers 12 one of which is used to mark the beginning of round tapestry needle for sewing in threads and blocking materials fingering weight yarn in two colours approximately 160m / 175yds of the main colour light gray and approximately 60m 66yds of the contrast colour black sample shown in miss la motte singles in colourway abalone mc and in colourway nightmare cc size one size 51cm 20 in circumference measured flat at the widest part of the hat the hat measures approximately 25cm 10 from the crown to cast on edge 2 abbreviations k knit p purl mc main colour cc contrast colour st st stocking stitch k2tog knit two stitches together in the front of the stitch gauge 28 stitches and 36 row is 10cm 4 in stranded knitting knitted in the round and blocked knitting to gauge is important to ensure that your knitted item is the correct size and to ensure that yardage requirements are similar to those stated in the pattern instructions 1 using smaller needles cast on 144 stitches in mc using the cast on method of your choice join to knit in the round being careful not to twist your stitches place stitch marker if using to mark the beginning of your round 2 work in k2 p2 ribbing until piece measures 4cm / 1 5 from cast on edge 3 change to your larger needles and knit 4 rounds of st st 4 begin knitting the colourwork using the chart from page 3 the pattern is 12 stitches wide and is repeated 12 times place a stitch marker if using after each pattern repetition you begin the chart from round 1 at the bottom right of the chart and read the chart from right to left it is recommended that you catch floats every 5 stitches to avoid long floats that are created by knitting large sections in a single colour 5 once you have completed the colourwork chart remove markers from step 4 and continue knitting in st st in mc until the work measures 15cm / 6 measured from cast on edge 6 begin crown shaping as described below switching to the longer circular needle for magic loop or dpns when required crown shaping round 1 k14 k2tog to end round 2 and all subsequent even rounds
